claims.claim: Returning citizens require mental and emotional healing post-incarceration.
claims.quote: I need like to heal mentally and emotionally. And I think like if I went through that, I can't imagine the amount of of other people that need healing in that way too.

claims.claim: Family support is crucial for successful reentry.
claims.quote: My mom, she dropped everything to come help support me, bring me home. But there's so many people that don't have that.

claims.claim: Many formerly incarcerated individuals struggle with the lack of a support system.
claims.quote: But there's so many people that don't have that. I'm lucky. I'm fortunate and I know that.

claims.claim: Experiences of incarceration can prompt individuals to work towards better reintegration support.
claims.quote: So when I came back to Michigan, my whole focus changed. And so that's when I. Started working with people who were also justice involved to say, how could we make things better?

claims.claim: Formerly incarcerated individuals face emotional and psychological trauma.
claims.quote: I've had my own experience of being incarcerated. It was a, a limited amount of time. But when I came home, I had never been through this process. I'd never been through an arrest or. What it meant to be stripped, searched, or what it meant to be thrown in a cell.

claims.claim: Being involved in community work can be a method of personal healing.
claims.quote: And so that's when I. Started working with people who were also justice involved to say, how could we make things better?
